## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hi there! I'm here to assist you with any Verus-related questions. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
I was wondering about the txt file that comes with each Verus download. What's its purpose?

**AI Assistant:**
The txt file included with each Verus download contains the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature. This allows users to verify the authenticity and integrity of the downloaded package. This is an important step to ensure you're getting the real deal and not a tampered-with package.

**User:**
Got it! So, how can I verify the signature of a downloaded Verus package using the command line?

**AI Assistant:**
You can verify the signature of a downloaded Verus package using the `verifyfile` command. Here's an example:

```
./verus verifyfile "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" /path/to/downloaded/file.tar.gz
```

This will check the signature of the file against the signer "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@". Do you have any experience with command-line tools, or would you like more info on how to use this command?

**User:**
That's helpful, thanks! What's the alternative way to verify a downloaded package, besides using the `verifyfile` command?

**AI Assistant:**
You can also verify a downloaded package using the `verifyhash` command, by providing the signer, signature, and checksum of the file. Here's an example:

```
./verus verifyhash "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" 0587c3da3d0f64015be98e097353a24d0581b9fbc1f3a788adf31a408c643023
```

This command provides an alternative way to verify the signature of a downloaded package.

**User:**
What happens if the signature verification is successful?

**AI Assistant:**
The result of a successful signature verification will be `true`, indicating that the signature is valid. This gives you confidence that the package you downloaded is genuine and hasn't been tampered with.

**User:**
I've heard there's an upcoming upgrade to the Verus Mainnet Protocol. What changes can I expect at block 1053660?

**AI Assistant:**
At block 1053660, the Verus Mainnet Protocol will upgrade to the new Komodo Notary Nodes for Komodo dPoW notarization, season 4, and a number of new capabilities. Additionally, there will be a change to the Verus Proof of Power staking and mining hash. This upgrade will bring some exciting new features and improvements to the network!

**User:**
That sounds interesting. What new features will be activated after the network upgrade?

**AI Assistant:**
After the upgrade, some of the new features that will be activated include:

* Added support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators
* Coinbase shielding will no longer be required on any coinbases from the past that have not yet been shielded
* Staking will now work on all normal ID balances, enabling full use of IDs for storing and staking funds
* A new `sendcurrency` API for the command line provides more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities
* `updateidentity` will now be able to change the case of characters in the name of a VerusID in the global locale
* Revocation identity will now lose all control over an ID after revocation, including the ability to still change the revocation identity itself
* Staking and hashing consensus protocol updates with VerusHash 2.2

These new features will enhance the overall user experience and provide more flexibility and control over your VerusIDs and assets. Do you have any specific questions about these new features?

What is the purpose of the txt file included with each Verus download?
The txt file included with each Verus download contains the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature. This allows users to verify the authenticity and integrity of the downloaded package.

## Verifying Downloads A txt file containing the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature, is included for each download. These packages have been signed with the identity "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@". 1) Extract downloaded archive 2) Verify signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file. 3) Extract archive to desired directory ### CLI examples **Verifying file directly** ``` ./verus verifyfile "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" AfcIEAABQSBXNoiaxzhPSEo99oIkVNEWvQP1ebMA5l4TNOlsUzi+DjoO9AcsQjAG9gF/HuVJlS5gAgaQN28Pwj6ExYWoY/dm /Downloads/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.0-1-amd64/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.0-1-amd64.tar.gz ``` **Verifying using a checksum** ``` ./verus verifyhash "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" AfcIEAABQSBXNoiaxzhPSEo99oIkVNEWvQP1ebMA5l4TNOlsUzi+DjoO9AcsQjAG9gF/HuVJlS5gAgaQN28Pwj6ExYWoY/dm 0587c3da3d0f64015be98e097353a24d0581b9fbc1f3a788adf31a408c643023 ```**The result will be true if the signature is valid.** ``` true ```**MAKE SURE TO UPGRADE BY June 14TH, OR YOU MAY NEED TO RESYNCHRONIZE THE BLOCKCHAIN IF YOU ARE RUNNING IN NATIVE MODE.**At block 1053660, the Verus Mainnet Protocol will upgrade to the new Komodo Notary Nodes for Komodo dPoW notarization, season 4, and a number of new capabilities, as well as a change to the Verus Proof of Power staking and mining hash will go live on the Verus mainnet as well.## The network upgrade will activate the following features: - Added support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators- Coinbase shielding will no longer be required on any coinbases from the past that have not yet been shielded.- Staking will now work on all normal ID balances, enabling full use of IDs for storing and staking funds.- A new `sendcurrency` API for the command line provides more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities.- `updateidentity` will now be able to change the case of characters in the name of a VerusID in the global locale.- Revocation identity will now lose all control over an ID after revocation, including the ability to still change the revocation identity itself, which it used to retain. After revocation now, the recovery identity will have full control over the revoked ID.- Staking and hashing consensus protocol updates with VerusHash 2.2# Disclaimer

What new features will be activated after the upcoming Verus network upgrade?

Some of the new features that will be activated after the network upgrade include:

* Added support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators
* Coinbase shielding will no longer be required on any coinbases from the past that have not yet been shielded
* Staking will now work on all normal ID balances, enabling full use of IDs for storing and staking funds
* A new `sendcurrency` API for the command line provides more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities
* `updateidentity` will now be able to change the case of characters in the name of a VerusID in the global locale
* Revocation identity will now lose all control over an ID after revocation, including the ability to still change the revocation identity itself
* Staking and hashing consensus protocol updates with VerusHash 2.2
